trial_identification.studytitle: Thin water consistency being aspirated into the lungs of patients who have been recommended thickened drinks by a Speech Pathologist
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised Controlled Study of the effects of oral intake of water in dysphagic patients who have been prescribed thickened fluids to assess hydration and quality of life.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions: Patients will be provided with water between meals following a strict oral hygeine regime that will be completed by nursing staff. Patients will be allowed unlimited amounts of water throughout the day. Patients will not be able to consume water during meals or half an hour post meals. Patients' will be able to consume thickened fluids with meals. The Speech Pathologist will monitor the patient's condition daily (temperature, chest status and medical notes). The duration of the intervention will last 5 days. post the intervention, the patients will remain on thick fluids only dependent on the presription of the Speech Pathologist.
interventions.comparator: Patients will be provided with thickened fluids only

primaryOutcome.outcome: Hydration levels in patients will increase. Fluid balance charts will be kept and monitored by the Speech Pathologist.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of life will improve. This will be measured via quality of life surveys pre and post thin fluid stage.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: People who have been prescribed thickened fluids as a result of a Speech Pathology assessment
